title: I deleted my NA account hoping i can get my username on the EUNE server but...
body:
So here's the gig
•I created an acc september 2015 on the NA servers
•I wanted to delete that NA account in august 2016, so i can get that username on the EUNE server
•I sent a request to Riot Games on _**13.08.2016**_ and they said that they're gonna delete it on _**30.08.2016**_ (my b-day :) )
•Yesterday was 30.08.2016 **AND MY ACCOUNT IS STILL NOT DELETED!!**

Can anyone tell me what's happening here and why isnt my account still not deleted or rather_ why can't i use the username that was on that account that i deleted (the account that i deleted was on the NA servers if ur losing track)?_ I want to play on EUNE with my friends

btw {{champion:245}} is better than {{champion:238}} (this was random xD) tell me ur opinions xD

replies.body: The deletion day is an approximation, like at some point during the day and not exactly midnight.  NA and EUNE are different regions, so the usernames are independent of each other.  If your username is taken on EUNE, then it's likely being used by another player entirely.  The username is also hidden to everyone except the account owner.  Curious, why go through such extremes for that?

Why the extremes? Short answer - I'm OCD
And no, my username is definitely not being used by someone else - it's unique and no one could've tought of it :)
Any help why can't i create an account?
Also did u vote for Zed? xD

There are commonly two reasons why an account couldn't be registered on a server:  If the username or email is already taken.  If the email has been taken, you can use a temporary address, and then change it to your preference through the account management guide.  Hope that helps!

I think they meant summoner name, not username.
summoner name is the name displayed to everyone, whereas the username is what you use to log in to the account.

I would recommend searching a database like op.gg or others that have player game records to see if there is potentially someone already in that region using that summoner name. Of course it's entirely possible that the name is taken but not being played on which I believe won't show any records, however it's usually the best place to start as it can provide results for taken/available names fast and easy.

If you're still having trouble with that, then I'd recommend submitting a ticket to the region where you want that name on (which would be EUNE in this case) and make an inquiry on whether that name is taken and/or the possibility of releasing that name if it has been inactive for the period of time required in order for someone else to take the name.

how do i submit that ticket?

go here to make a ticket: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/requests/new

then select "I have a question about League of Legends/Riot Games"

then you will notice one of the areas to fill in says  "Region"

in that area I would suggest putting EUNE so that it will be sent to that region and someone from there can check their info to see if they potentially have that name taken or available.

Hope this works out well
